body: Without api data, we cant get an exact number, but we can try an make some estimations. Reddit type websites seem to follow the 90-9-1 (lurker-upvoter/commenter-poster)rule pretty often. I would say that ruqqus has higher engagement between commenting and posters, so i would merge those groups as 90-7-3. Using that as a metric plus some observations as a poster myself who lurks on new, i would estimate around 3000-6000 daily lurkers with 100-200 content posters give or take. This makes sense with the number of upvotes +Ruqqus stickies get. Would love to see the actual data

body: Human social dynamics really are amazing. The difference in character type between commenters / upvoters / lurkers would be an interesting thing for sociologists to study. The idea that only 1 in a hundred people actually speaks is kind of mind blowing, it makes you think about how distorted "public opinion" might actually be.
